p: Unlike SARS and MERS pandemics where neurological complications were uncommon, yet presented with critical outcomes, in COVID 19 pandemic, the neurological symptoms reported frequently even in mild cases. Through case reports, the mortality rate of the SARS and MERS cases exhibited central nervous manifestation was (6/11) 54.5% with accompanied comorbidities in (8/11) 72%, while those with peripheral manifestation were not likely to present with fatal outcomes. Comparatively, 25% of the COVID 19 neurological quandaries befall in CNS complications.
